meanings.definition: A low-growing annual weed with small white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The carpetweed spread across the garden, covering the ground with its tiny white blooms.
meanings.sent2: I spotted some carpetweed growing near the fence in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The carpetweed seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with the other plants in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The carpetweed was like a blanket of snow on the green grass.
meanings.sent5: The carpetweed's delicate flowers added a touch of beauty to the otherwise plain garden.

meanings.definition: To carpetweed a garden is to remove all traces of the weed.
meanings.sent1: I need to carpetweed the flower bed before the weeds take over.
meanings.sent2: She spent the whole afternoon carpetweeding the front yard to make it look neat.
meanings.sent3: As soon as she saw the carpetweed sprouting, she grabbed her gardening tools.
meanings.sent4: He carpetweeded the backyard with determination, not stopping until every weed was gone.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's goal was to carpetweed the entire lawn and keep it weed-free.
